low/no sensitivity:
- HNO and underlying national-level needs assessment data
- National and provincial dashboard and underlying aggregated data from complaints and feedback mechanisms (excluding data related to SEA)
- CODs
- 3W/4W data (at national and provincial level)
- 3W/4W data at district level (with the exception of clusters/AoRs that have determined this data to be a higher sensitivity through a documented Data Impact Assessment)
moderate sensitivity:
- Survey or needs assessment data aggregated to the district level
- District-level dashboard and underlying aggregated data from complaints and feedback mechanisms (excluding data related to SEA)
high sensitivity:
- Survey or needs assessment data aggregated to the community level
- Community-level data from complaints and feedback mechanisms (excluding data related to SEA)
- Aid-Worker Contact Details / Lists
severe sensitivity:
- Raw survey and raw needs assessment data (, e.g. individual/HH level)
- Raw data from complaints and feedback mechanisms
- Any data related to SEA
- Protection and GBV-specific assessment data
- Personal data of beneficiaries (i.e. Beneficiary lists)
- Any data on local level authorisations and access related organisational and provincial data

low/no sensitivity:
- Humanitarian Needs and Response Plan
- Administrative boundaries (COD AB) and demographic statistics (COD-PS)
- Datasets and shapefiles (including PCOD for administrative boundaries)
- Humanitarian response dashboard; Humanitarian overview; - Emergency Tracking Tool (ETT)
- Movement alert from the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM)
- Situation Reports (SitReps)
- Flash updates on a specific crisis
- Dashboards
- Presence maps (name of partners and location) by sectoral group (Cluster)
- Nutrition survey/assessment reports
- IPC reports on acute food insecurity and acute malnutrition
moderate sensitivity:
- Aggregated survey results on sensitive topics (e.g., protection monitoring reports at commune and district level)
- Aggregated data on activities and indicators at provincial/district and commune level, from 5W data for cluster lead agencies x, y, and z
- Aggregated data on activities and indicators at province/district level, from 5W data with encrypted names of organizations and implementing partners
- Stock monitoring reports with encrypted names and/or without partner names and exact locations
high sensitivity:
- Contact details of humanitarian workers / Lists
- Rapid needs assessment report (aggregated results from Focus Group Discussions (FGDs) and Key Informant Interviews (KIIs), which include general facts such as total number of households and individuals, main vulnerabilities and needs, no disaggregated data)
- Intention survey (results like number of households, no disaggregated data)
- Verification survey (aggregated results like number of households, no disaggregated data)
- Any report aiming to share information on vulnerabilities at district level (not linked to a specific individual)
severe sensitivity:
- Any raw survey or assessment data, e.g., intention surveys, protection needs assessments, responses from focus group discussions and key informant interviews, etc.
- Personal data of individuals served (e.g., biometric data and/or registration lists, verification survey dataset, data on incidents of gender-based violence / list of recorded GBV cases)
- Referral reports/forms

low/no sensitivity:
Consolidated, aggregated and cleared anonymized information, at an administrative level agreed by the group [admin 2, unless otherwise specified], including:
- Operational presence infographics monthly infographics
- Factsheets
- Situation report
- Humanitarian snapshot
- Bulletin and Other clusters public documents
moderate sensitivity:
- 5W matrix in Excel or infographics at deeper than admin3 level
- Aggregated assessments reports
- Figures (population, response)
- Meeting minutes
- Humanitarian contact list
- Assessment reports not anonymized
- Email communication not anonymized
- Other IM products or document classified by its author
high sensitivity:
- Disaggregated assessments reports
- Sensitive infographics
- Field activity planning
- Any other document classified by its author
severe sensitivity:
- Aid-Worker personal Contact Details
- Individual survey responses
- Personal data (i.e. beneficiary lists), etc.
- Access information
- Any other document classified by its author
- Health facility and operational partners names (only where explicit and written permission has been given by the relevant hub)

low/no sensitivity:
Compiled, aggregated, and anonymized information at the agreed level of aggregation for sharing. This includes the following types:
Humanitarian situation overview (Snapshot)
Factsheets
Meeting schedules
Common Operational DataSet (COD)
Operational presence (5W)
Funding tracking dashboards
Newsletters
Humanitarian bulletins
Protection policies (PSEA)
Call for tenders
Other sector documents
moderate sensitivity:
Humanitarian access maps
5W matrix in Excel or infographic at a deeper level than admin level 3
Aggregated assessment reports
Figures (population, response)
Meeting minutes
List of humanitarian contacts
Non-anonymized assessment reports
Non-anonymized email communications
Other IM products
Cash transfer programming (CASH)
Any other document classified as such by its author
high sensitivity:
Security information data
Biometric data
Personnel information
Individual data related to GBV and protection
Disaggregated assessment reports
Sensitive infographics
Field activity planning
Any other document classified as such by its author
severe sensitivity:
Personal contact details of humanitarian worker
Individual survey responses
Personal data (e.g., lists of beneficiaries), etc.
Any other document classified as such by its author

low/no sensitivity:
Compiled, aggregated, and anonymized information at the agreed level of aggregation for sharing. This includes the following types:
- Common Operational Dataset (COD)
- Population projections
- Operational presence (5W)
- Humanitarian situation overview (Snapshot)
- Humanitarian bulletins
- Humanitarian Response Plan (HRP)
- Humanitarian Needs Overview (HNO)/Needs Assessments
- IPC AFI and IPC Acute Malnutrition results (SMART survey)
- Meeting minutes from regular Cluster meetings
moderate sensitivity:
- Humanitarian access maps
- 5W matrix in Excel or infographic at a deeper level than admin level 3
- Aggregated assessment reports
- Figures (population, response)
- Cash transfer programming (CASH)
- List of humanitarian contacts (limited circulation within the humanitarian community)
high sensitivity:
- Security information data
- Sensitive infographics
- Field activity planning
severe sensitivity:
- Personal contact details of humanitarian workers
- Individual survey responses
- Personal data (i.e., beneficiary lists), etc.
- Contact details of the authors of alerts or protection notes
- Confidential notes and reports on human rights violations or on the protection of civilians

low/no sensitivity:
- CODs   
- Access restrictions at the district level
moderate sensitivity: - Survey results aggregated to the district level
high sensitivity:
- Survey results aggregated to the household level and with additional disaggregation based on different indicators
- Aid-Worker Contact Details / Lists
severe sensitivity:
- Raw survey data, e.g. individual survey responses at HH-level data
- Personal data of beneficiaries (i.e. beneficiary lists) [footnote: Personally identifiable data like beneficiary lists should be shared within bilateral agreements based on organizational policies framed in accordance with the minimum standards prescribed by the UN General Assembly, Guidelines for the Regulation of Computerized Personal Data Files, as adopted by Resolution A/Res/45/95 of 14 December 1990, available at: http://www.refworld.org/docid/3ddcafaac.html and other international instruments concerning the protection of personal data and individuals’ privacy.]

Flash updates including Snapshot data

low/no sensitivity:
- Humanitarian Needs and Response Plan and underlying national-level data
- Common Operational Datasets (CODs)
- 3W/4W data, partner presence mapping and response monitoring data (without Partner names in certain areas) at state, regional (ADM1) and district (ADM2) level)
- Multi cluster/cluster specific Needs Assessments and related data aggregated at district (ADM2) level 
- Facility data with locations (e.g. coordinates), including for health facilities, education facilities, nutrition centers, marketplaces and water points, unless indicated otherwise by the relevant cluster or partner
- Analysis based on survey results, e.g. the SMART survey, coverage surveys
- Analysis based on mass MUAC screening
- Disease related information
- Flow monitoring registry and report
- Data included in the Emergency Tracking Tool dashboard 
- Baseline IDP assessment results
- Protection risk monitoring results at the state level
- Protection of civilians’ related data in UN SG quarterly reports on the situation in Somalia 1
- Data on humanitarian access aggregated to the administrative level reflected in humanitarian access snapshots
- General access map at a low resolution for presentation purposes (similar to the type of access map published in the HNRP)
moderate sensitivity:
- Aggregated survey results at the area level (Operational Zones (‘OPZ’))
- Information on access restrictions (including the number and type of access restriction) aggregated to the district level (ADM2)
- Emergency Tracking Tool results
high sensitivity:
- Aid-Worker Contact Details
- Anonymized survey results, e.g. figures, at the settlement level (ADM3)
- Participatory Migration Mapping reports
- Data on demographic composition at the household level
- Anonymized line lists
severe sensitivity:
- Identifiable survey data, e.g. individual survey responses
- Personal data of beneficiaries (including beneficiary lists, patient records, line lists, and biometric registration data) ,  
- Access actor mapping data
- Security incident and access incident records
- Identifiable Mass MUAC survey results
- Identifiable flow monitoring survey results
- Participatory Migration Mapping results
- Individual reports on violations of International Humanitarian Law or Human Rights Law
- Data on gender-based violence cases and cases of sexual exploitation and abuse
- Data related to military and armed groups presence and activity, including Areas of Control
-  Anonymized mapping of vulnerable groups at heightened risk of marginalization or stigmatization (e.g. minorities)

low/no sensitivity:
HNO and underlying summary data 
Inter-Sector Needs Assessment (ISNA) Summary Data (State and County summary tables)
FSNMS dashboards and information products (IPC analysis at county level)

high sensitivity:
ISNA data aggregated at the payam-level (for ISNA TWG members only)
FSNMS data aggregated at the county level
severe sensitivity:
Anonymized ISNA data at the household level

Personal data of beneficiaries (i.e. Beneficiary lists)
Any other anonymized data that could, under certain circumstances, identify individuals or small groups of vulnerable individuals thus putting them in danger

low/no sensitivity:
- HNO and underlying national-level aggregate and anonymized survey results
- Admin boundaries
- CODs (e.g. population dataset)
- Access restrictions (district level)
- 3W/4W data (at national and district level)
moderate sensitivity:
- Aggregated district-level survey results (e.g. aggregated to the district level with additional disaggregation based on different indicators) which are fully anonymized using Statistical Disclosure Control and/or other methods, to prevent any re-identification
- District-level information on overall protection situation
- 3W/4W data (at the discretion of Clusters/AORs)
high sensitivity:
- Household-level survey results (e.g. household level with disaggregation based on different indicators) which are fully anonymized using Statistical Disclosure Control and/or other methods, to prevent any re-identification
- Aid-Worker Contact Details / Lists
severe sensitivity:
- Raw survey data, e.g. individual survey responses with no anonymization methods applied
- Personal data of beneficiaries (including beneficiary lists, case management records, protection monitoring at the individual level, patient data/records),

low/no sensitivity: - HNO and underlying national-level aggregate survey results
- CODs
- Access restrictions (district level)
- 3W/4W data (at national and district level)
moderate sensitivity: - Aggregated survey results (e.g. aggregated to the district level)
- 3W/4W data* (for x, y and z clusters, this data at XX level is restricted)
high sensitivity: - Aggregated survey results (e.g. aggregated to the household level and with additional disaggregation based on different indicators)
severe sensitivity: - Raw survey data, e.g. individual survey responses at HH-level data
